Sir L* Worthington-Evans, Bart.,M.P., -Secretary of 1State for War. jIRISH PRISONERS With reference to Cabinet 86 (21),, Conclusion& MILITARY LA"Y.4, the Lord Chancellor reported to the conference that, having regard to all present conditions,it was not advisable to provoke a conflict withthe Irish Courts and that therefore internmentorders under the Irish "DORA" should be made which would enable General. Macready to hold the prisoners and make a return which would cause the writ to bo discharged.2, Whitehall Gardens, S.W-.;11th November, 1921'.
